results.title: Midnight cowboy
results.creator_credit: Jerome Hellman-John Schlesinger Productions, Jerome Hellman and John Schlesinger
results.brief_description: Tough, potent and shocking; an haunting look at the American Dream - turned nightmare. As Ratso Rizzo, scrounging, sleazy small-time con-man with big dreams, Dustin Hoffman gives one of the most unforgettable performances of his career. And as Joe Buck, the good-looking, naively charming Texas “cowboy” convinced that he is the salvation of many lonely, love-starved New York women, Jon Voight is magnificent. Living on the tattered fringe of society, an unlikely bond grows between these two outcasts that is powerful and poignant. From first frame to last, this multi-award winning film is a transcendant, compassionate film masterpiece that hits right at the heart.

results.title: Midaq Alley = El Callejon de los Milagros
results.creator_credit: Alameda Films, Instituto Mexicano de Cinematografia, Alfredo Ripstein Jr and Jorge Fons
results.brief_description: Set in a poor section of downtown Mexico City, “Midaq Alley” is a story of several characters, each with their own story to tell, and each bound together inextricably by their inhabitance of this rather rundown derelict neighbourhood. The film is broken up into four separate tales which all intertwine and connect with each other. The first tale “Rutilio” introduces a middle-aged owner of a small bar in the town. Rutilio (Ernesto Gomez Cruz), estranged from his wife and family is about to embark on an affair, the consequences of which will have a devastating effect on his family particularly his son, Chava. The second tale “Alma” is about a young, beautiful and rather naive girl, Alma (Selma Hayek) who is patiently waiting for the return of her fiance Abel (Bruno Bichir) from the United States. Abel has gone to the States to make money so he can come back and marry Alma. Life however becomes complicated for Alma and feeling lonely and missing Abel, she finds herself attracted to the attentions of the suave but rather unsavoury Jose Luis (Daniel Gimenez Cacho). Her life is about to be changed forever. The third story “Susanita” tells of the spinster landlady of a small apartment block in the neighbourhood who longs for romance in her rather sad and lonely life. Susanita (Margarita Sanz) unwittingly and tragically ends up in a “sham” marriage. “El Regreso” (The Return), the fourth story, ties up all the plot threads of romance, deceit, human frailty, sadness and despair into one final act. Based on the novel by Egyptian writer and Nobel prize winner, Naguib Mahfuz, and winner of 45 international film awards, including Berlin and Chicago, this is a fine film with an excellent supporting cast including Maria Rojo, Delia Casanova, Claudio Obregon, Juan Manuel Bernal.

results.title: Michael Collins
results.creator_credit: Geffen Pictures, Stephen Woolley, Redmond Morris and Neil Jordan
results.brief_description: Ireland 1916, His dreams inspired hope, his words ignited passion and his courage forged a nation’s destiny. “Michael Collins” (Liam Neeson) is the story of a real-life patriot whose bravery and unswerving dedication to the Irish people changed history as it made him into a legend. Collins quest would bring a man raised on war into an even more dangerous battle for peace. It would cost him his life and make him a hero for the ages. This film encompasses romance, violence, valour, rage, burning hope and fiery tragedy. The performances given by Liam Neeson, Alan Rickman, Stephen Rea, Julia Roberts, Aidan Quinn and Charles Dance are superb and linger long after the movie finishes.

results.title: Miami rhapsody
results.creator_credit: Hollywood Pictures, David Frankel and Barry Jossen
results.brief_description: This hilariously sexy comedy has critics everywhere standing and cheering! The irresistible Sarah Jessica Parker (Honeymoon in Vegas, L.A. story) stars as Gwyn Marcus - a recently-engaged young woman about to make a shockingly funny discovery: marriage and fidelity don’t always go hand-in-hand, especially in her own family! From then on, it’s comical chaos as one by one, Gwyn unravels the details of their outrageously tangled affairs. Stars Sarah Jessica Parker, Mia Farrow, and Antonio Banderas.

results.title: Metropolis
results.creator_credit: UFA, Erich Pommer and Fritz Lang
results.brief_description: A classic early SF story of a dehumanised futuristic society in which the workers toil below the ground for the benefit of an elite who live above. Fascinating sequences are woven into the sentimental story of the romance between the son of the city’s ruler and a saintly girl from below ground.

results.title: Metro
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Ray Murray Jr, Randy Fedlman and Thomas Carter
results.brief_description: Eddie Murphy utilises his manic comic skills as a hostage negotiator working for the San Francisco Police Department. His cool-under-fire demeanour is tested when his girlfriend is taken hostage by a man who was also responsible for the death of a friend and colleague. Starring Eddie Murphy, Michael Rapaport, and Michael Wincott.

results.title: Metal skin
results.creator_credit: Daniel Scharf Productions, Southern Star Entertainment, Daniel Scharf and Geoffrey Wright
results.brief_description: After the controversial success of “Romper Stomper”, Geoffrey Wright’s second feature was a critical and commercial failure. However, this story about four young teenagers who find their only joy and exhileration in drag racing, is a mesmerising study of contemporary working class alienation. Set in Melbourne’s western suburbs the film is a hyper-kinetic study of the fractures and tensions at play in Australian society. The young cast is excellent as is the editing and cinematography.

results.title: Merrill's marauders
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, United States Pictures, Milton Sperling and Samuel Fuller
results.brief_description: The viewer is plunged directly into war. The documentary element - the reconstruction of the campaign of General Merrill’s American infantry regiment deep behind Japanese lines in Burma - seems to exist on a level independent of the more stylised attempt to abstract the rhythms of combat and survival. Because he experienced combat at first hand as an infantry man in World War II, Fuller has a certain commitment to represent that reality thus bringing the contradictions between re-creation and generic convention closer to the surface than is usual for the combat genre.

results.title: Mermaids (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Nicita/Lloyd Productions, Palmer, Lauren Lloyd, Wallis Nicita, Patrick Palmer and Richard Benjamin
results.brief_description: Winona Ryder plays a strict Catholic schoolgirl growing up in the conservative early sixties and saddled with the grooviest and sexiest mother in town. A very funny romantic comedy, “Mermaids” celebrates the tensions, love and agonies of mother-daughter relationships. With Bob Hoskins and featuring an outstanding performance by Cher as the free-spirited mother of a very unconventional family. Based on the book by Patty Dann.
